description: A massive junkyard and slum area on the outskirts of Goa Kingdom where the impoverished and discarded live. Despite its harsh conditions, it represents freedom for Sabo, Ace, and Luffy.

keyEvents.title: Sabo Reveals His Noble Heritage
keyEvents.description: At their hideout in Grey Terminal, Sabo confesses to Ace and Luffy that he is the son of nobleman Outlook III.
keyEvents.significance: Grey Terminal serves as the setting where Sabo can be honest with his chosen family about his birth origins.

keyEvents.title: The Brotherhood Sakazuki Ceremony
keyEvents.description: Ace, Sabo, and Luffy perform the traditional sakazuki ceremony in Grey Terminal, exchanging sake cups to officially become sworn brothers.
keyEvents.significance: The most important event in Grey Terminal during this episode, cementing the brotherly bond that defines these characters.

statusHistory.reason: Functioning as the home and training ground for the three brothers

description: The wealthy noble district of Goa Kingdom, characterized by pristine streets, luxury, and strict social hierarchy. Home to the aristocratic families including Sabo's parents.

keyEvents.title: Sabo's Childhood Flashback
keyEvents.description: Flashbacks show young Sabo's oppressive life in High Town, where his father destroyed his drawing and forced him to study for an arranged marriage.
keyEvents.significance: Illustrates the emotional abuse and suppression Sabo faced in his noble life in High Town.

keyEvents.title: Selling Crocodile Leather to Nobles
keyEvents.description: The three brothers disguise themselves as merchants and infiltrate High Town to sell crocodile leather to wealthy nobles.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the stark class divide and the boys' ability to navigate between the two worlds.

keyEvents.title: Restaurant Incident
keyEvents.description: Luffy accidentally reveals his rubber powers at a High Town restaurant, causing the three brothers to flee.
keyEvents.significance: Anime-original scene showing the clash between the boys' wild nature and High Town's refined society.

statusHistory.reason: Functioning as the noble district of Goa Kingdom

description: A kingdom on Dawn Island known as 'the most beautiful kingdom in East Blue,' though this beauty hides extreme class inequality and social oppression. Consists of High Town for nobles and Grey Terminal for the poor.

keyEvents.title: Outlook III Recognizes Sabo
keyEvents.description: In the streets of Goa Kingdom, nobleman Outlook III recognizes his son Sabo, but Sabo denies knowing him.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the tension between Sabo's two lives and the class divisions within the kingdom.

statusHistory.reason: Functioning kingdom during the flashback period

name.japanese: グレイ・ターミナル近くの森

description: A dangerous forest near Grey Terminal where Ace, Sabo, and Luffy train and hunt for food. Home to various wild animals including large predators.

keyEvents.title: Three Brothers Defeat a Crocodile
keyEvents.description: The three brothers work together to defeat a large crocodile in the forest, demonstrating their growing strength and teamwork.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the boys' progression as fighters and their effective cooperation through training.

statusHistory.reason: Training ground for the three brothers
